snippet: A drive across the U.S. reveals an electorate that is crawling back from the recession, conflicted about new military action in the Middle East, and blaming Washington.
abstract: Five-day, 1,100-mile road trip through seven American states reveals voters crawling back from recession who are laden with emotional and financial fatigue, doubts about military involvement and frustration with elected leaders in Washington.
lead_paragraph: A drive across the U.S. reveals an electorate that is crawling back from the recession, conflicted about new military action in the Middle East, and blaming Washington.

headline.main: From Mid-Atlantic to Midwest, Voters Express Frustration and Fatigue
headline.print_headline: From Mid-Atlantic to Midwest, Voters Exude Frustration and Fatigue

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
